marketNews.title: World Bank Outlook and Global Economic Updates
marketNews.content:
World Bank Outlook Indonesia: In its October 2024 outlook, the World Bank raised its projection for Indonesia’s GDP growth to 5.0% YoY for 2024 and 5.1% YoY for 2025, each 0.1 percentage point higher than the April 2024 outlook. The Bank notes that Indonesia will benefit from higher household consumption, investment and government spending. World Bank East Asia and Pacific Chief Economist Aaditya Mattoo said that among major East-Asia-Pacific economies, only Indonesia is expected to grow in 2024 and 2025 at a rate equal to or above pre-pandemic levels.

World Bank Outlook China: The same October outlook increased China’s 2024 growth projection to 4.8% YoY, 0.3 percentage points above the April outlook, supported by a recovery in services consumption and exports early 2024. China’s 2025 growth is projected at 4.3% YoY, unchanged from April, with lower growth attributed to a persistent property market weakness, weak consumer and investor confidence, and structural challenges such as ageing population and global tensions.

China Fiscal Briefing: The Chinese government announced that Finance Minister Lan Fo’an will hold a briefing on fiscal policy on Saturday 12 Oct at 10:00 local time, amid a weakening rally after the National Development and Reform Commission announced a weaker-than-expected stimulus.

China Stimulus: On Tuesday 8 Oct, the National Development and Reform Commission announced a fiscal stimulus of 200 billion yuan for 2025, far below analyst consensus of a 3-trillion-yuan package.

Indonesia Political Team: Kontan reported that the economic team in Prabowo Subianto’s cabinet will not differ much from President Joko Widodo’s cabinet, with incumbent ministers such as Sri Mulyani, Erick Thohir and Bahlil Lahadalia retained. Earlier, campaign adviser Drajad Wibowo told the Australian Financial Review in February 2024 that Sri Mulyani was unlikely to join the next administration, noting differing views with Prabowo on development policy.

Prabowo Tax Cut: Gerindra Party Deputy Chairman and Prabowo’s brother Hashim Djojohadikusumo said Prabowo plans to cut the corporate income tax rate from 22% to 20% to boost Indonesia’s investment attractiveness, stimulate businesses, improve tax compliance and support corporate sector growth.

Gaikindo Sales: Gaikindo reported that domestic vehicle wholesale sales in September 2024 were 72,667 units, down 9.1% YoY and 4.8% MoM. Although still negative, the YoY decline was better than the 9M24 decline to 633,218 units, down 16.2% YoY, which represented 57.6% of the 2024 target of 1.1 million units. Gaikindo has previously announced a possible revision of the 2024 new-vehicle wholesale target to 1.1 million units.

Bank Indonesia Retail Forecast: Bank Indonesia estimated retail sales to grow 4.7% YoY but contract 2.5% MoM in September 2024, due to reduced consumer demand after the end of discount programs for the Republic of Indonesia’s Independence Day celebrations. Retail sales in August 2024 grew 1.7% MoM and 5.8% YoY.

Oil World Biodiesel: Senior analyst David Mielke at Reuters estimated that Indonesia’s plan to raise the CPO blend in biodiesel from 35% to 40% will tighten global CPO supplies. The increase would raise domestic CPO usage in biodiesel from 11 million tons to 13.9 million tons. Glenauk Economics’ Managing Director Julian McGill expects CPO to trade around Rp4,000 per ton in 2025.

tickerNews.title: LEAD Converts $20 Million Debt at Rp186 per Share
tickerNews.content: Logindo Samudramakmur (LEAD) plans a private placement of 1.75 billion new shares at an execution price of Rp186 per share to convert debt of US$20 million. The corporate action aims to improve the company's financial structure and will dilute existing shareholders by 30.17%. PT Jalan Terang Samudra, OCP Asia Fund IV (SF1) Pte. Ltd., and OCP Asia Fund V (SF1) Pte. Ltd. will take part in the new shares, with post-transaction ownership of 23.19%, 2.59% and 4.39% respectively. Previously they held no shares in LEAD. The plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders on 14 November 2024. Based on the 1H24 balance sheet, the conversion will reduce total debt from US$94.6 million to US$74.6 million, while equity will increase from US$23.5 million to US$43.5 million. With cash of US$7.6 million, the Net Debt-to-Equity ratio will fall from 3.69x to 1.54x. Key Takeaway: We view this corporate action as positive sentiment for LEAD given the high execution price and the prospect of improved financial structure. In the past two years LEAD has not recorded positive net profit due to high interest expenses, although the offshore supply vessel (OSV) sector has recovered and the company posted revenue growth. Assuming the converted debt carries a blended interest rate similar to 1H24, LEAD could reduce financial expense by approximately US$1.7 million per year, potentially allowing net profit of US$1.25 million for FY24 annualized. Using an exchange rate of Rp15,900 per US$, this net profit translates to EPS of Rp3.46 per share based on post-transaction share count. With the new share count, LEAD could trade at a FY24 annualized P/E of 33.8x. Following the announcement, LEAD shares jumped 26.5% to Rp148 per share on Wednesday (9 Oct).

tickerNews.title: BUKA Shares Traded for Approximately Rp2.1 Trillion in Negotiated Market
tickerNews.content: BUKA: Bukalapak shares were traded in the negotiated market for a total value of approximately Rp2.1 trillion on Wednesday (9 Oct). The jumbo transaction involved about 13.5 billion shares at an average price of Rp155 per share. The number of shares matches the holding of Ant Group’s Hong Kong-based investment vehicle, Ant International (Hong Kong) Investment Limited, in BUKA.

tickerNews.title: ASII Reports September 2024 Wholesale Vehicle Sales Decline
tickerNews.content: ASII: Astra International reported wholesale sales of Toyota of 25,384 units (down 2.1% YoY, down 2.3% MoM) in September 2024, while wholesale sales of Daihatsu were 12,676 units (down 15.5% YoY, down 8.3% MoM). Combined, the two main brands posted a 7% YoY decline in September 2024, slightly better than the industry average decline of 9.1% YoY, resulting in a combined market share increase to 52.4% (vs 51.2% in September 2023). Cumulatively for the first nine months of 2024, wholesale sales of Toyota reached 208,301 units (down 15.5% YoY) and Daihatsu 125,849 units (down 14.7% YoY).

tickerNews.title: BBNI Discusses Potential Minority Stake for Sea Ltd.
tickerNews.content: BBNI: The President Director of PT Bank Hibank Indonesia, Jenny Wiriyanto, said there is an option to make Sea Ltd. (NYSE: SE) a minority shareholder of the company, though she could not confirm the timing. Previously, DealStreetAsia reported at the end of February 2024 that Sea Ltd. planned to acquire 10-15% of Hibank in Q2 2024. Hibank is the rebranded Bank Mayora after being acquired by BBNI in 2022.

tickerNews.title: DSSA Said to Lead Tender Offer for EXCL-FREN Merger
tickerNews.content: DSSA: BloombergTechnoz reported that Dian Swastatika Sentosa will be the party conducting a tender offer for the merged entity of XL Axiata (EXCL) and Smartfren Telecom (FREN) at a price of Rp3,500-4,000 per share. In response, DSSA Director Hermawan Tarjono said he had not heard of such information. EXCL CEO Dian Siswarini declined to comment, and FREN CEO Merza Fachys said he was unaware of the technical aspects of the EXCL-FREN merger.

tickerNews.title: RAJA Subsidiary Wins Fuel Pipeline Contract Worth Rp982.5 Billion
tickerNews.content: RAJA: Rukun Raharja announced that its subsidiary PT Petrotech Penta Nusa will lead a consortium to provide fuel pipeline services for the PT Pertamina Patra Niaga project from Tanjung Batu to Samarinda. PT Petrotech Penta Nusa will invest approximately Rp982.5 billion according to its participation share. Construction will last two years, followed by ten years of operation and maintenance. The consortium also includes PT Citra Panji Manunggal and PT Bakrie Pipe Industries.

tickerNews.title: PGAS Signs Fuel Pipeline Service Contract for Cikampek-Plumpang
tickerNews.content: PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara, through its subsidiary PT Pertamina Gas, signed a contract to provide fuel pipeline services for the Cikampek-Plumpang segment for PT Pertamina Patra Niaga. The agreement term is three years of construction and ten years of operation and maintenance.

tickerNews.title: INKP Share Purchase Increases APP Purinusa Ownership
tickerNews.content: INKP: PT APP Purinusa Ekapersada, the controlling shareholder of Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper, purchased 18.6 million INKP shares at Rp8,600 per share on 3 Oct 2024, a transaction worth about Rp160 billion. After the transaction, APP Purinusa’s ownership in INKP increased from 57.12% to 57.46%.

tickerNews.title: LABA Chairman Sells 4.18 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: LABA: Green Power Group Chairman Huang Yeping sold 4.18 million LABA shares at an average price of Rp598 per share on 7 Oct 2024, a transaction valued at roughly Rp2.5 billion. After the sale, Huang’s ownership fell from 0.49% to 0.11%.
